newsitem.title: UK: IPE Brent closes higher on refinery outage.
newsitem.headline: IPE Brent closes higher on refinery outage.

text.p: IPE Brent crude staged a strong recovery to end in positive territory after a Venezuelan refinery problem reversed early losses, brokers said.
December Brent closed at $24.63 per barrel, two cents above Monday's settlement, having touched a low of $24.17.
"The refinery news was the main thing that brought prices back up," a broker said.
Technical problems with a 108,000 barrel per day catalytic cracker at Venezuela's Amuay refinery caused an unscheduled shutdown, but a spokesman said international sales would not be affected.
An Amuay spokesman said the problem would be fixed by the end of the week.
Earlier, Brent prices had fallen after Colonial pipeline reported a surge in shipping orders for sending heating oil from the Gulf coast to the Northeast.
A Colonial spokeman said a gasoline pipeline would be used for heating oil deliveries. But this prompted a rally in gasoline prices, which partially offset the weaker crude and heating oil.
However, Nov IPE gas oil failed to catch all of the late rally, closing $3.50 lower at $230.75 per tonne.

Traders were waiting for the weekly stock data from the American Petroleum Institute after the close which are expected to show a one million barrel build in distillate stocks, according to a survey by Reuters. Crude stocks were expected to build by 200,000 barrels and gasoline was expected to fall by one million barrels.
